summary: This is an FBI Special Agent's affidavit in support of a search warrant application for compact discs seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence on July 7, 2019. The affidavit details the discovery of numerous discs with labels referencing girls, nudes, and specific locations, and seeks authorization to search them for evidence of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. It references a grand jury indictment of Epstein and includes details from a victim interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier accused of sex trafficking and sexually abusing dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York and Florida from at least 2002 to 2005.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed the initial search warrant for the Epstein residence on July 6, 2019, and the second warrant on July 7, 2019. Also swore in the FBI Special Agent for this affidavit.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein that is attached as Exhibit A to the affidavit.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: A victim of Epstein's sexual abuse between 2002-2005 who provided detailed descriptions of the interior of the New York residence, including a torso bust and taxidermied dog. She is also pursuing a civil claim against Epstein.

persons.name: Employee-1
persons.context: A New York-based employee who, on behalf of Epstein, contacted victims to schedule appointments for sexual encounters at the New York residence.

persons.name: Employee-2
persons.context: An assistant who scheduled sexual encounters for Epstein with minor victims in Florida, sometimes while located in New York.

persons.name: Employee-3
persons.context: An assistant who scheduled sexual encounters for Epstein with minor victims in Florida.

persons.name: Minor Victim-1
persons.context: A minor victim recruited in 2002, repeatedly abused by Epstein in New York, paid hundreds per encounter, and encouraged to recruit other girls. She told Epstein her age.

persons.name: Minor Victim-2
persons.context: A minor victim recruited in 2004, repeatedly abused by Epstein in Florida, paid hundreds per encounter, and encouraged to recruit other girls.

persons.name: Minor Victim-3
persons.context: A minor victim recruited in 2005, repeatedly abused by Epstein in Florida, paid hundreds per encounter, and encouraged to recruit other girls. She told Epstein her age.

connections.description: Epstein directed Employee-1, based in New York, to communicate with victims via phone to arrange for them to return to the New York residence for sexual encounters.
Epstein arranged for Employee-2 to contact victims in Florida to schedule encounters at his Palm Beach residence prior to his travel there.
Employee-3 placed phone calls to minor victims, including Minor Victim-3, to schedule sexual encounters with Epstein at the Palm Beach residence.
Epstein sexually abused Victim-1 on multiple occasions at his New York residence between 2002 and 2005 when she was under 18.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-1 repeatedly at his New York residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-2 repeatedly at his Palm Beach residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-3 repeatedly at his Palm Beach residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Employee-1, on behalf of Epstein, placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-1 in 2004 to schedule an appointment for her to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.
Employee-2, on behalf of Epstein, placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-2 in 2005 to schedule an appointment for her to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.
Employee-2, on behalf of Epstein, placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-3 in Florida in 2005 to schedule an appointment for her to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.
Employee-3 placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-3 in 2004 to schedule an appointment for her to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: First Search Warrant Execution at Epstein Residence
events.description: Law enforcement officers commenced executing a search warrant at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, at approximately 6 p.m. The search was paused later that evening to seek a new warrant.

events.title: Second Search Warrant Execution and Seizure of Evidence
events.description: After a new warrant was signed, law enforcement resumed searching the Epstein residence at approximately 2:30 a.m. and seized numerous compact discs, binders of photographs, and other items from safes, dressers, and closets.

events.title: Beginning of Alleged Abuse Pattern
events.description: The indictment alleges that from at least 2002, Epstein began enticing and recruiting dozens of minor girls to engage in sex acts with him at his New York and Florida residences.

events.title: Abuse and Recruitment of Multiple Victims
events.description: In or about 2004, Epstein enticed and recruited multiple minor victims, including Minor Victim-1, Minor Victim-2, and Minor Victim-3, for paid sex acts. Employee-1 called Minor Victim-1 to schedule an appointment.

events.title: Continued Abuse and Scheduling by Employees
events.description: In or about 2005, Employees-2 and -3 placed phone calls to Minor Victim-2 and Minor Victim-3 in Florida to schedule appointments for paid sex acts with Epstein.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein Residence / New York Residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: On July 7, 2019, the FBI seized dozens of compact discs from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, many labeled with handwritten titles like 'Young Prelaya and LaLasa,' 'Nudes 00-24,' 'Girl Pics Nude,' 'Thai Massage,' and female names, suggesting they contained evidence of sexual exploitation.
The search also revealed a binder labeled 'PB Girls,' a folder marked 'Sue' containing nude photos of a young girl, and loose Polaroid photographs of nude females who appeared to be teenagers.
A victim (Victim-1) provided detailed corroborated descriptions of the residence's interior, including a bust of a human torso she believed was a sex toy and a taxidermied dog.

Epstein was indicted on July 2, 2019, for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, alleging he abused dozens of girls as young as 14 from 2002-2005 in New York and Florida, using a network of victims and employees to recruit and schedule encounters.

The affidavit reveals Epstein's method of operation: recruiting minors for 'massages' that escalated into sexual acts, paying them hundreds in cash, and incentivizing victims to recruit other girls, creating a 'vast network' of underage victims.
